title: Coding Challenge
text:
Show the code
# Read in libraries
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lets_plot import *

LetsPlot.setup_html(isolated_frame=True)

title: Coding Challenge
text:
Question #2:

[Fix the series to all be np.nan and calculate the standard deviation (2 decimal places):]


Show the code
problem = pd.Series(['N/A', 15, 22, 45, 31, -999, 21, 2, 0, 0, 0, 'broken'])

# Replace invalid values with np.nan
problem_cleaned = pd.to_numeric(problem, errors='coerce')  # Convert to numeric, invalid values become NaN
problem_cleaned.replace(-999, np.nan, inplace=True)  # Replace -999 with NaN

# Calculate standard deviation (ignoring NaN values)
std_dev = round(problem_cleaned.std(), 2)

print(f"Cleaned Series:\n{problem_cleaned}")
print(f"Standard Deviation: {std_dev}")


Cleaned Series:
0      NaN
1     15.0
2     22.0
3     45.0
4     31.0
5      NaN
6     21.0
7      2.0
8      0.0
9      0.0
10     0.0
11     NaN
dtype: float64
Standard Deviation: 16.14

title: Coding Challenge
text:
Show the code
# Read in libraries
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

from lets_plot import *

LetsPlot.setup_html(isolated_frame=True)
Show the code
# Read in the names data
url = "https://github.com/byuidatascience/data4names/raw/master/data-raw/names_year/names_year.csv"
names = pd.read_csv(url)

title: Coding Challenge
text:
Question #:

[How old is someone named Russell? #1]


Show the code
# Assuming the dataset 'names' contains columns for 'name', 'year', and 'Total'
russell = names[names['name'] == 'Russell'][['year', 'Total']]

# Create a new column 'age' as 2024 - year
russell['age'] = 2024 - russell['year']




q = (ggplot(russell, aes(x='age', y='Total')) 
     + geom_line(color='red')  # Line color red
     + geom_point(aes(x='age', y='Total'), color='blue', size=5, shape=21, 
                  data=russell[russell['age'] == 100])  # Highlight the point for 100 years
     + geom_text(data=russell[russell['age'] == 100], 
                 mapping=aes(x='age', y='Total', label="'Russell M. Nelson'"), 
                 vjust=-0.5, hjust=1.5, color='darkblue', angle=0, size=8)  # Add label
     + ggtitle('How old is someone named Russell?')  # Title
     + xlab('Age')  # X-axis label
     + ylab('Frequency')  # Y-axis label
)

title: Taylor Everett’s Resume
text:
Student and Merchandising Assistant

tayloreverett72@gmail.com


Working and Studying Business Analytics Full Time


Power BI, Excel, MySQL, Python



Furthering my knowledge in financial analytics as well as EDI and PowerBI




2021-2025 BYU-I.



2022-Current Merchandising Assistant, Country Supplier

Ordered a wide variety of product to 55 stores.
Mid States SPOC for Country Supplier and Oversaw all communication between the two companies

Was involved in the Implementation of a new EDI process for stores to recieve product into inventory
Analyze large data to find valuable actionable insights for the replenishment team
Created useful reporting workbooks that auto update upon opening

2022-2023 Back-Up Receiver, C-A-L Ranch - Completed Multiple tasks such as checking inventory into our system as well as sending out packages to other stores - Analyzed all my work was done to perfection or near perfection - Ensured inventory numbers stay accurate that way our reorder points are correct - Train others in the position to the same level that I am at that way the work was done the proper way - Ensuring freight is moving out of the back room in a timely matter - Collaborated with many individuals at the corporate level to solve problems that come up
2020-2021 Laborer, Arylett

Completed Multiple tasks from manufacturing to shipping and packaging

Learned to guide and teach people about the job as they were hired. I went from the new slow guy to one of the fastest workers in a matter of weeks

Oversaw from start to finish over many products throughout a shift
Completed tasks 8 hours a day at a constant rate of speed

title: Coding Challenge
text:
Show the code
# Read in libraries
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lets_plot import *

LetsPlot.setup_html(isolated_frame=True)

title: Coding Challenge
text:
Question #3:

Recreate the Boxplot]


Show the code
ages = pd.Series(["10-25", "10-25", "26-35", "56-85", "0-9", "46-55",
                  "56-85", "0-9", "26-35", "56-85", "0-9", "10-25"])

# Define age categories
def categorize_age(age_range):
    if age_range in ["0-9", "10-25", "26-35"]:
        return "young"
    else:
        return "old"

# Apply categorization
categories = ages.apply(categorize_age)

# Create a DataFrame with random values (to simulate associated data)
np.random.seed(42)  # For reproducibility
data = pd.DataFrame({
    "variable": categories,
    "value": np.random.randint(10, 90, size=len(ages))  # Random values
})

# Create the box plot
lets_plot_plot = (ggplot(data) +
                  geom_boxplot(aes(x='variable', y='value'), fill='blue') +
                  ggsize(600, 600) +
                  ggtitle("Age Group Box Plot"))

# Show the plot
lets_plot_plot
